lines.text: Enter FENTON and ANNE PAGE

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: I see I cannot get thy fathers love Therefore no more turn me to him, sweet Nan.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Alas, how then

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: Why, thou must be thyself. He doth object I am too great of birth, And that, my state being galld with my expense, I seek to heal it only by his wealth: Besides these, other bars he lays before me, My riots past, my wild societies And tells me tis a thing impossible I should love thee but as a property.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: May be he tells you true.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: No, heaven so speed me in my time to come! Albeit I will confess thy fathers wealth Was the first motive that I wood thee, Anne: Yet, wooing thee, I found thee of more value Than stamps in gold or sums in sealed bags And tis the very riches of thyself That now I aim at.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Gentle Master Fenton, Yet seek my fathers love still seek it, sir: If opportunity and humblest suit Cannot attain it, why, then,hark you hither!
They converse apart
Enter SHALLOW, SLENDER, and MISTRESS QUICKLY

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Break their talk, Mistress Quickly: my kinsman shall speak for himself.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Ill make a shaft or a bolt ont: slid, tis but venturing.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Be not dismayed.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: No, she shall not dismay me: I care not for that, but that I am afeard.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Hark ye Master Slender would speak a word with you.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: I come to him. This is my fathers choice. O, what a world of vile illfavord faults Looks handsome in three hundred pounds ayear!
Aside

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: And how does good Master Fenton Pray you, a word with you.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Shes coming to her, coz. O boy, thou hadst a father!

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: I had a father, Mistress Anne my uncle can tell you good jests of him. Pray you, uncle, tell Mistress Anne the jest, how my father stole two geese out of a pen, good uncle.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Mistress Anne, my cousin loves you.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Ay, that I do as well as I love any woman in Gloucestershire.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: He will maintain you like a gentlewoman.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Ay, that I will, come cut and longtail, under the degree of a squire.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: He will make you a hundred and fifty pounds jointure.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Good Master Shallow, let him woo for himself.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Marry, I thank you for it I thank you for that good comfort. She calls you, coz: Ill leave you.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Now, Master Slender,

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Now, good Mistress Anne,

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: What is your will

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: My will! ods heartlings, thats a pretty jest indeed! I neer made my will yet, I thank heaven I am not such a sickly creature, I give heaven praise.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: I mean, Master Slender, what would you with me

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Truly, for mine own part, I would little or nothing with you. Your father and my uncle hath made motions: if it be my luck, so if not, happy man be his dole! They can tell you how things go better than I can: you may ask your father here he comes.
Enter PAGE and MISTRESS PAGE

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Now, Master Slender: love him, daughter Anne. Why, how now! what does Master Fenton here You wrong me, sir, thus still to haunt my house: I told you, sir, my daughter is disposed of.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: Nay, Master Page, be not impatient.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Good Master Fenton, come not to my child.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: She is no match for you.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: Sir, will you hear me

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: No, good Master Fenton. Come, Master Shallow come, son Slender, in. Knowing my mind, you wrong me, Master Fenton.
Exeunt PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Speak to Mistress Page.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: Good Mistress Page, for that I love your daughter In such a righteous fashion as I do, Perforce, against all cheques, rebukes and manners, I must advance the colours of my love And not retire: let me have your good will.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Good mother, do not marry me to yond fool.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: I mean it not I seek you a better husband.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Thats my master, master doctor.

lines.speaker: anne page
lines.text: Alas, I had rather be set quick i the earth And bowld to death with turnips!

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Come, trouble not yourself. Good Master Fenton, I will not be your friend nor enemy: My daughter will I question how she loves you, And as I find her, so am I affected. Till then farewell, sir: she must needs go in Her father will be angry.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: Farewell, gentle mistress: farewell, Nan.
Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE and ANNE PAGE

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: This is my doing, now: Nay, said I, will you cast away your child on a fool, and a physician Look on Master Fenton: this is my doing.

lines.speaker: fenton
lines.text: I thank thee and I pray thee, once tonight Give my sweet Nan this ring: theres for thy pains.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Now heaven send thee good fortune! A kind heart he hath: a woman would run through fire and water for such a kind heart. But yet I would my master had Mistress Anne or I would Master Slender had her or, in sooth, I would Master Fenton had her I will do what I can for them all three for so I have promised, and Ill be as good as my word but speciously for Master Fenton. Well, I must of another errand to Sir John Falstaff from my two mistresses: what a beast am I to slack it!
Exit FENTON
Exit
